poem:
Title: A Sonnet to Spring Strolls

Like ships unlacing their mooring ropes,
we step into the burgeoning day.
Spring whispers in each bud that opens,
guiding us along paths of May.
We cast shadows on trillium thickets,
under the calligraphy of branches,
where horizons hide untracked secrets,
like surprising woodland romances.
A snapshot of these green dalliances,
held in our hearts and not our lens,
Spring, your elegant dances,
outlive mere holiday dividends.
